result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler D. Nicholas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence(s) currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
Shall pay $450 to victim MJB.
Shall pay $13,012.16 to Dean Health Southeast.
Shall pay $972.27 to State of WI HMS WI Casualty Recovery.
The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's income.
Must obtain/maintain full-time employment and shall job search full time if unemployed.
Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim or her family, including but not limited to in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic device or through a third party. 
  Shall have no contact with children under 10 years of age and only supervised contact with children over the age of 10 years. 
  Contact IS allowed with his own children if approved by DOC.
Shall not physically disipline any children.
  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence(s) currently serving

Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler D. Nicholas in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court heard, has be advised that today's purpose was that the Def. was going to w/d his plea, court finds victim rights compliance. Atty Mayer heard, Def. requests to w/d his NGI plea and set for sent. hearing. Court heard, questions Def., gives rights to Def., questions Def. regarding Atty Mayer, Court questions Atty Mayer. Atty Mayer heard. Court heard, satisfied that Def.'s w/d is done FVK&I, Court heard further, Court will allow w/d of NGI, Def. stands convicted of offense based off of 10/11 plea hearing, will be set for final sentencing. Discussion held regarding Victim Impact Statement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

character letters
character letter

Called 1:07 pm.  Defendant Tyler D. Nicholas in court, in custody with attorney David Robert Westrick.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion of presentence investigation.  Atty. Westick is heard on issue with page 3, Atty. Tienstra responds, Court is heard, will not consider that information.  Page 17 - atty. Westrick heard, Court responds, understands that it is agent's impression.  Atty. Tienstra - P. 1 and 17 - inaccurately states enhancer, Curt notes error.  Page 2, Atty. Tienstra makes notes about the health of the child.  Court reviews letter received on behalf of Mr. Nicholas today.  Victim's mother makes statement.  Victim's grandfather makes statement.  Victim's aunt makes statement.  Victim's aunt makes statement.  Victim Witness Coordinator reads father's statement aloud.  Atty. Tienstra makes argument.  Exhibit list prepared.  Atty. Tienstra requests restitution of $13462.16, Atty. Westrick agrees.  Court orders restitution in that amount.  Atty. Westrick is heard on argument.  Court takes break at 2:14 pm.  Back on the record 2:26 pm, same appearances.  Defendant makes statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

17 years DOC;
12 years IC,
5 years ES,
Consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed.  

Condtions of ES:
All conditions stated in PSI
In addition - no contact with children under 10, and supervised contact with children over 10.
Restitution of $13462.16.

Court informs that he cannot vote, cannot possess firearms until civil rights are restored.  Remanded to Dodge Court Sheriff.
Writ
Writ

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on October 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Tyler D. Nicholas in court, in custody with attorney David Robert Westrick.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victims Rights are compliant.  Child's parents and an aunt appeared in Court.  Attorney Westrick indicated there is no agreement and that they wish to obtain a PSI.  The Court reviewed CPR and PQWOR; Ct. heard plea of No Contest to the charge in the Amended Information. The Court found a sufficient factual basis, that the defendan'ts plea was given FKVI, and the Court accepted plea, finding the Defendant guilty of Felony Causing Great Bodily Harm as a Repeater (11CF49-Jefferson County).  Court found factual basis in the Criminal Complaint/Information.  The Court ordered a PSI and sentencing to be scheduled.

10:30 - Defendant Tyler D. Nicholas in court, in custody via video from Jefferson Cty Jail.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $20,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with MJB w/f DOB 2/25/91; LMB w/f DOB 5/8/13 and no unsupervised contact with any children.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Review hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.

9:34 ADA Tienstra for State. Def FTA. Atty Tienstra states in custody; likely in Jefferson County but unsure - requests adjournment. Court heard; grants adjournment to locate defendant and send summons.
